p.s: The main purpose of the given scene is to show the police brutality against the black community.
Another purpose of the scene is to show how traumatizing it is for black children to see one of their family experiencing police brutality.
The scene is set in a diner at night.

The background music in the beginning is slow and sensetivesensitive it creates a relaxed and happy atmosphere, till Starr sees King and the two gang members, the music then suddely changes to a more threatening music, which creates tension and danger in the scene.
There is a zoom on King and the gang members, when Starr first sees them, which makes them seem more dangerous.
MavericksMaverick'sagressiveaggressive body language and facial expression, when he walks outside the diner, shows his attitude towards King and the respect he doesn't have for him.
The red and blue lights from the police createscreate an even mormore exciting atmosphere.
When Maverick is pushed on the ground, there is a close up on his face, there is a light in his face, so the viewer can see his facial expression showing how angry and frustrated he is.

There is an intense eye contact between Starr and the black police officer, while she's filming him pushing her father on the ground, one can see in his facial expression that he's realizing something.

In the end there is a close up on Sekhani crying, his facial expression shows how frightendfrightened he is, that this happendhappened to his father, the viewer can see how traumatizing it can be for a little child to experience something like this.
